app Module¶

Api methods¶

POST /disable_checks¶

Disable list of checks

Json Parameters:
 
  • checks (list) – list of checks to enable
GET /get_templates¶

Get all active templates

This method will be moved to global API

Return all plans info

Example request:

GET /get_templates
Accept: application/json, text/javascript

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type    application/json

{
  "test": [
    "bla_plan"
  ],
  "professional": [
    "uname",
    "netstat"
  ],
  "status": "OK",
  "basic": [
    "cpu"
  ]
}
POST /enable_checks¶

Enable list of checks

Json Parameters:
 
  • checks (list) – list of dictionaries with checks to enable
  • checks[‘name’] (string) – check name
  • checks[‘item’] (string) – A check item or the keyword None for checks that do not need an item.
  • checks[‘params’] (string) – Paramters for the check or the keyword None for checks that do not need a parameter.
POST /add_template¶

Add new plan with checks

This method will be moved to global API

The plan stores in json file for now. It will move to db If plan name already exists it will overwrite checks and update the file

Json Parameters:
 
  • name (string) – plan to be changed
  • checks (list) – checks in the plan
  • active (bool) – if plan is active
  • include_plans (list) – other existing plans. Checks from this plans will be included to this plan

Post data:

{
        "name": "Test",
        "include_plans": [
                "Basic"
                ],
        "checks":["bla_plan"],

        "active": true
}

Example request:

POST /add_template
Accept: application/json, text/javascript

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type    application/json
{
    "status": "OK",
    "name": "Test"
}
POST /disable_host¶

Disable host in the check_mk configuration

Json Parameters:
 
  • host (string) – host to be disabled

Post data:

{
    "name": "Tests",
    "host": "10.10.10.10"
}

Example request:

POST /disable_host
Accept: application/json, text/javascript

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type    application/json
{
  "status": "OK",
  "host": "10.10.10.10"
}
POST /enable_check¶

Enable check

Json Parameters:
 
  • name (string) – check name
  • item (string) – A check item or the keyword None for checks that do not need an item.
  • params (string) – Paramters for the check or the keyword None for checks that do not need a parameter.
POST /enable_host¶

Enable host in xmd

add host to check_mk config

Json Parameters:
 
  • host (string) – host to be enabled

Post data:

{
    "name": "Tests",
    "host": "10.10.10.10"
}

Example request:

POST /enable_host
Accept: application/json, text/javascript

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type    application/json
{
  "status": "OK",
  "host": "10.10.10.10",
  "name": "Tests"
}
GET /delete_check/(plan)/(check)¶

Deletes check from given plan

This method will be moved to global API

Parameters:
  • plan (string) – plan to be changed
  • check (string) – check to be removed from the plan

Example request:

GET /delete_check/professional/new
Accept: application/json, text/javascript

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type    application/json
{
  "status": "OK",
  "check": "new",
  "plan": "professional"
}
GET /add_check/(plan)/(check)¶

Add check to given plan

This method will be moved to global API

Parameters:
  • plan (string) – plan to be changed
  • check (string) – check to be added to the plan

Example request:

GET /add_check/professional/new
Accept: application/json, text/javascript

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type    application/json
{
  "status": "OK",
  "check": "new",
  "plan": "professional"
}
GET /disable_check/(check)¶

Disable check

Parameters:
  • check (string) – check to disable
GET /get_template/(template)¶

Get template info

This method will be moved to global API

Parameters:
  • template (string) – plan name

Example request:

GET /get_template/professional
Accept: application/json, text/javascript

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type    application/json

{
  "status": "OK",
  "plan": [
    "uname",
    "netstat"
  ],
  "name": "professional"
}
GET /url¶

404 handler

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
Content-Type    application/json

{'status': 'error', 'message': 'Not found: url'}
code 404:unknown url

Common methods¶

app.make_json_app(import_name, **kwargs)¶

Creates a JSON-oriented Flask app.

All error responses that you don’t specifically manage yourself will have application/json content type, and will contain JSON like this (just an example):

{ “message”: “405: Method Not Allowed” }
